p: After the age of 29 years, the gender difference in HIV and TB-HIV prevalence decreases with males contributing more to the burdens of HIV and TB-HIV infections in the age group 35â€“39 years, males vs. females: 9.8% vs. 9.0% for HIV and 12.9% vs. 3.0% for TB-HIV. The variations in TB, HIV and TB-HIV infections by gender across age groups are summarized in Fig 2.
